item.title: 美国联邦航空局调查波音公司举报人对 787 和 777 喷气式飞机质量的指控
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（FAA）发言人周二表示，该局正在调查一名波音公司举报人的指控，该举报人称波音公司在生产 787 和 777 喷气式飞机的过程中忽视了安全和质量问题。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is investigating a Boeing whistleblower's claims that the company dismissed safety and quality concerns in the production of the planemaker's 787 and 777 jets, an agency spokesperson said Tuesday.】

item.title: Cruise 将在凤凰城重新引入人工驾驶车队
item.description: 通用汽车公司的自动驾驶初创公司 Cruise 周二表示，它将从亚利桑那州的凤凰城开始，在一些城市重新引入一支由人类驾驶的小型车队。【原文：General Motors' autonomous driving startup, Cruise, said on Tuesday it will reintroduce a small fleet of human-driven vehicles in some cities, starting with Phoenix in Arizona.】

item.title: 国际钢铁协会称 2024 年全球钢铁需求将增长 1.7
item.description: 世界钢铁协会周二表示，预计2024年全球钢铁需求将增长1.7%，达到17.93亿吨。【原文：Global steel demand is expected to rise by 1.7% to 1.793 billion metric tons in 2024, the World Steel Association said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 聚焦：大流行过后，巴黎奥运会有望创下 NBC 广告销售纪录
item.description: 随着 2024 年巴黎奥运会 7 月开幕式的日益临近，美国广播公司 NBCUniversal 看到了主要企业赞助商对这一全球顶级体育赛事的新兴趣，因为自 COVID-19 大流行以来，球迷们有望首次挤满奥运场馆。【原文：As the July opening ceremony for the 2024 Paris Olympics draws closer, U.S. broadcaster NBCUniversal is seeing renewed interest from major corporate sponsors in the premier global sporting event as fans are expected to fill Olympic stadiums for the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 英特尔披露新人工智能芯片细节 对抗英伟达主导地位
item.description: 英特尔在周二举行的 "愿景"（Vision）活动上详细介绍了其新版人工智能芯片，该芯片瞄准了英伟达（Nvidia）在支持人工智能的半导体领域的主导地位。【原文：Intel detailed a new version of its artificial intelligence chip at its Vision event on Tuesday that takes aim at Nvidia's dominance in semiconductors that power AI.】

item.title: 个性化癌症疫苗在早期研究中显示出疗效，Moderna跃跃欲试
item.description: 周二早盘，Moderna 公司股价上涨了 8%，因为该公司与默克公司合作开发的个性化癌症疫苗在一项早期试验中对一种头颈部癌症患者显示出了积极的反应。【原文：Moderna shares rose 8% in morning trade on Tuesday after the company's individualized cancer vaccine developed with Merck showed positive response in an early-stage trial in patients with a type of head and neck cancer.】

item.title: 阿根廷总统米莱伊本周将参观特斯拉工厂并会见马斯克
item.description: 阿根廷总统发言人曼努埃尔-阿多尼（Manuel Adorni）周二告诉记者，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）将于周六访问位于得克萨斯州的特斯拉工厂，并会见该公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei is set to visit a Tesla factory in Texas and meet with the firm's chief executive Elon Musk on Saturday, presidential spokesman Manuel Adorni told reporters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 由于质量检查力度加大，波音公司三月份交付量减少一半
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，由于监管机构加强了质量检查和审计，737 MAX 的产量下滑，该公司 3 月份交付了 29 架飞机，比去年同期的 64 架减少了一半以上。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday it had delivered 29 airplanes in March, down more than half from the 64 delivered in the same month a year ago, as 737 MAX production slipped on increased quality checks and audits by regulators.】

item.title: 黑莓因与 AMD 合作开发机器人系统而获益
item.description: 加拿大黑莓公司与先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）合作推出了一个平台，该平台将为工业和医疗保健行业提供更好的机器人功能。【原文：BlackBerry shares jumped more than 7% on Tuesday after the Canadian company teamed up with Advanced Micro Devices to roll out a platform that will enable better robotics capabilities for the industrial and healthcare industries.】

item.title: 美国法院支持环保局批准加州电动汽车规则的决定
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周二维持了环境保护局的决定，即给予加利福尼亚州豁免权，允许其自行设定尾气排放限制和电动汽车要求。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday upheld the Environmental Protection Agency's decision to grant California a waiver to set its own tailpipe emissions limits and electric vehicle requirements.】

item.title: 降息呼声减弱，美国国债收益率预测上升
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，债券策略师们上调了未来几个月的美国国债收益率预期，原因是通胀持续走高和经济活动复苏推动金融市场缓和了对美联储今年降息的预期。【原文：Bond strategists upgraded their U.S. Treasury yield forecasts for coming months as sticky inflation and resilient economic activity have pushed financial markets to temper expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts this year, a Reuters poll showed.】

item.title: 诺华将在产品开发领域裁员 680 人
item.description: 瑞士诺华制药公司（Novartis）周二表示，该公司将在其研发机构中裁减多达 680 个工作岗位，该机构负责帮助公司将药物推向市场。【原文：Novartis is to cut up to 680 jobs in its development organisation, which helps bring its drugs to market, the Swiss pharmaceuticals company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）称，G20 新兴经济体的冲击冲击了富裕世界的增长
item.description: 据国际货币基金组织周二发布的一份报告称，二十国集团（G20）新兴经济体的国内冲击正日益影响富裕国家的经济增长。【原文：Domestic shocks in emerging economies in the G20 are increasingly impacting growth in the rich world, according to a report published on Tuesday by the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 路透社调查显示：巴西 3 月消费者价格预计将继续低迷
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，巴西 3 月份的消费价格涨幅可能仍将受到抑制，但一些服务业的价格涨幅继续令人担忧，这使得经济学家们预计食品和其他商品将加速通货紧缩。【原文：Brazil's consumer price increases are likely to have remained subdued in March but some services continued to show worrying increases, leading economists to expect quicker disinflation to come from food and other goods, a Reuters poll showed.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商 Lucid 第一季度交付量超预期
item.description: 本周二，Lucid 公司公布的第一季度交付量高于市场预期，原因是降价促进了对其豪华电动轿车的需求。【原文：Lucid reported first-quarter deliveries above market expectations on Tuesday as price cuts helped boost demand for its luxury electric sedans.】

item.title: 美国环保局制定削减化工厂污染的最终规则
item.description: 美国环境保护局周二最终确定了一项规则，该规则将减少化工厂产生的致癌有毒空气污染物，并要求对空气质量进行定期监测，以保护这些设施周围的社区。【原文：The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency on Tuesday finalized a rule that will reduce cancer-causing toxic air pollutants from chemical plants and require regular air quality monitoring to protect communities surrounding those facilities.】

item.title: 日本马自达汽车公司首席执行官接受CNBC采访，可能将汽车货运从巴尔的摩转移到另一个港口
item.description: 马自达汽车公司首席执行官在接受 CNBC 采访时表示，马自达汽车可能不得不暂时将货物从巴尔的摩转移到另一个港口，以避免延误。【原文：Mazda Motor will probably have to temporarily move shipments to another port from Baltimore to avoid delays, the automaker's CEO said in a CNBC interview.】

item.title: 澳大利亚在并购重组中制定强制通知规则
item.description: 根据本周三公布的对澳大利亚收购规则的全面修改，计划在澳大利亚进行收购的大公司必须首先获得反垄断监管机构的许可，该机构将能够阻止 "巩固 "大公司市场力量的小型交易。【原文：Large companies planning a takeover in Australia will first have to seek clearance from the antitrust regulator, which will be able to block small deals that "entrench" a big firm's market power, under sweeping changes to the country's buyout rules to be unveiled on Wednesday.】

item.title: 诺福克将以 6 亿美元和解俄亥俄州脱轨集体诉讼案
item.description: 美国铁路运营商诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）周二表示，该公司已达成一项 6 亿美元的协议，以解决与去年俄亥俄州东巴勒斯坦脱轨事故有关的集体诉讼。【原文：U.S. railroad operator Norfolk Southern said on Tuesday it had reached a $600 million deal to resolve a class action lawsuit related to the East Palestine, Ohio derailment last year.】

item.title: 美股变动在即，CLS 下跌推迟外汇截止日期
item.description: 最大的货币结算系统 CLS 集团周二表示，它将不会改变外汇交易支付指令的截止时间，这对希望从美国一项新规定中获得一些缓和的外国资产管理公司来说是一个打击，因为这项新规定使他们面临交易失败的风险。【原文：CLS Group, the largest currency settlement system, said on Tuesday it will not change its cut-off time for payment instructions for foreign exchange trades, dealing a blow to foreign asset managers hoping for some reprieve from a new U.S. rule putting them at risk of transaction failure.】

item.title: 谷歌推出基于 Arm 的数据中心处理器和新型人工智能芯片
item.description: 谷歌周二披露了其新版数据中心人工智能芯片的细节，并宣布推出基于 Arm 的Ⅳ级中央处理器。【原文：Google on Tuesday revealed the details of a new version of its data center artificial intelligence chips and announced an Arm-based , based central processor.】

item.title: 辉瑞 RSV 疫苗在 60 岁以下高风险成人试验中达到目标
item.description: 辉瑞公司周二表示，其呼吸道合胞病毒（RSV）疫苗 Abrysvo 的耐受性良好，在 60 岁以下高风险成人中产生的免疫反应与老年人相似，而老年人的免疫反应已经获得批准。【原文：Pfizer said on Tuesday its respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) vaccine Abrysvo was well tolerated and generated an immune response in higher risk adults under the age of 60 similar to that in older adults, for whom the shot is already approved.】

item.title: 微软将在日本投资 29 亿美元促进人工智能业务发展 - 日经新闻
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周二援引微软公司总裁的话报道，微软公司将在未来两年内投资约29亿美元，以促进其在日本的人工智能（AI）业务。【原文：Microsoft Corp will invest about $2.9 billion over the next two years to boost its artificial intelligence (AI) business in Japan, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Tuesday citing the company president.】

item.title: 聚焦：花旗集团首席执行官面临增长挑战，全面改革令员工震怒
item.description: 花旗集团首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）于 9 月份宣布对花旗庞大的组织结构进行全面改革，裁员 5000 人以削减成本，此后，投资者对首席执行官简-弗雷泽的回报是股价大涨。接下来，他们希望看到财富管理和投资银行业务的增长。【原文：Citigroup investors have rewarded CEO Jane Fraser with a share price boost after Fraser announced a sweeping overhaul of Citi’s sprawling structure in September, cutting costs by laying off 5,000 employees. Next, they want to see growth in wealth management and investment banking.】

item.title: 拥有中国分支机构的全球企业受到更便宜人民币资金的诱惑
item.description: 在中国开展业务的全球公司越来越多地发行人民币债务，为在中国的业务融资，因为六年来首次出现了发行人民币债务比用美元融资更便宜的情况。【原文：Global companies with China businesses are increasingly issuing renminbi debt to finance operations there, as for the first time in six years it has become cheaper to do so rather than raising money in U.S. dollars.】

item.title: 早间竞价商品价格阻碍通胀观点
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 汇丰加速中国财富管理业务扩张，有望实现招聘目标
item.description: 汇丰银行全球财富业务主管表示，尽管面临经济逆风，该行仍计划加快在中国的财富业务扩张步伐，并有望在明年将员工人数增加近一倍，以推进其亚洲支点战略。【原文：HSBC plans to accelerate the expansion of its wealth business in China despite economic headwinds and is on track to nearly double its headcount by next year, its global wealth head said, as the lender pushes ahead with its Asia pivot strategy.】

item.title: 通胀数据公布前期货价格持平
item.description: 美国股指期货周二持平，原因是投资者在本周晚些时候的一项关键性通胀数据公布前避免下大赌注，该数据可能会影响美联储今年的降息立场。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were flat on Tuesday, as investors refrained from placing large bets ahead of a crucial inflation reading later in the week that could influence the Federal Reserve's stance on rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 美国海湾重质原油价格坚挺，供应趋紧
item.description: 最近几周，美国墨西哥湾沿岸重质原油的价格攀升，罕见地接近轻质油的价格，这是供应紧张的一个迹象，可能会加剧汽油价格的上涨。【原文：Prices for heavier crude oil along the U.S. Gulf Coast have climbed in recent weeks, trading at a rare near-par with lighter oil, a sign of supply tightness that could add to rising gasoline prices.】

item.title: 美国小型企业景气度下滑至 11 年多来最低水平
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于对通胀的担忧加剧，3月份美国小型企业的信心下滑至11年多以来的最低水平。【原文：U.S. small-business confidence slipped to the lowest level in more than 11 years in March amid rising concerns about inflation, according to a survey on Tuesday.】
